data.title: Previously Funded Research
data.meta_description: Learn about our previously funded research by scientists at some of the world's top cancer centers and institutes in the U.S., Canada, Israel, and China.
data.text:
Since its founding, the SWCRF has provided nearly $100 million in funding to more than 200 science investigators at top research institutions all over the world.

Through our Institute Without Walls™, we have funded research that studies cancers of the blood (leukemia and lymphoma), brain, breast, colon, liver, lung, pancreas, and prostate along with programs that study childhood cancers, cancer cell reprogramming, and tumor dormancy. Below is a highlight of our research areas and the scientists we have funded.

Tumor Dormancy

- Julio A. Aguirre-Ghiso, Ph.D., Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

- Eduardo F. Farias, Ph.D., Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

- Emily Bernstein, Ph.D., Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
